alert.note: Alert for Wilkes (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 8:04PM EDT until July 08 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Thunderstorms With Heavy Rainfall Impacting Wilkes County... ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Wilkes County in northwest North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 759 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated an area of thunderstorms with heavy rainfall persisting over northeastern Wilkes County. Areas between the Wilkes County Airport and Mulberry have experienced 1.5 and 3.0 inches of rain during the past hour. Overflowing poor drainage areas will result in minor flooding within the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Muddy Branch, Big Bugaboo Creek, Roaring River, Little Sandy Creek, Elkin Creek, Camp Branch, Bee Tree Branch, Grassy Fork, Hughes Branch, East Prong Roaring River and Mulberry Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will increase the threat for flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Wilkesboro... Ronda... Roaring River... Wilkes County Airport... Hays... Pleasant Hill... - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
